message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with deep learning-based human action recognition in still images, which is a problem commonly addressed in the computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) communities. The proposed method involves the use of a human-mask loss to guide the activations of feature maps, which is a technique that falls under the umbrella of supervised learning (cs.AI). The paper also evaluates its approach on two popular datasets for action recognition in still images, which are commonly used in multimedia (cs.MM) and information retrieval (cs.IR) research.
